intro: Anapausia dentata, commonly known as the toothed anapausia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves with distinctive toothed margins, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Anapausia dentata is often found in moist, sunny environments and is adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils.
